Description: Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle reconstructed from numerous fragments and completed with plaster; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below with one wide band in added red; exterior: chain of opposed lotuses (with some red preserved on kalyxes) and palmettes with red on preserved on some cuffs and petals; below, frieze of chevrons and diamonds between two broad black bands; one band of short vertical strokes above foot, and black band around outer and inner edges of foot; underside: two pairs of concentric lines.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Dunbabin, T. J. (ed.), Perachora II: Pottery, Ivories, Scarabs and other Objects. The Sanctuaries of Hera Akraia and Limenia. Oxford 1962, 257, no. 2485, pl. 103, no. 2485a-2485b. The reconstruction of the kotyle did not take into account that the vessel originally had two horizontal handles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.079) (Phase 1)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 43, pl. VII, no. 4)
